election_record.label: New Hampshire 1801 Governor

overview.note: The total votes for John T. Gilman, as reported in newspapers and town records, is 11,098 votes.
The total votes for Timothy Walker, as reported in newspapers and town records, is 5,319 votes.

sub_unit.name: Acworth
sub_unit.note: The Farmer's Museum, or Lay Preacher's Gazette (Walpole, NH) and Dartmouth Gazette (Hanover, NH) list John T. Gilman with 57 votes and John Langdon with 47 votes.

sub_unit.name: Alstead
sub_unit.note: The Farmer's Museum, or Lay Preacher's Gazette (Walpole, NH) lists John T. Gilman with 156 votes.

sub_unit.name: Charlestown
sub_unit.note: John Taylor Gilman had a majority of 110 votes.

sub_unit.name: Claremont
sub_unit.note: The United States Oracle of the Day (Portsmouth, NH) and The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH) list 1 scattering vote.
The Farmer's Museum, or Lay Preacher's Gazette (Walpole, NH) and Dartmouth Gazette (Hanover, NH) list Timothy Walker with 3 votes.

sub_unit.name: Dublin
sub_unit.note: The History of Dublin lists John T. Gilman with 68 votes and Timothy Farrar with 4 votes.

sub_unit.name: Gilsum
sub_unit.note: The Farmer's Museum, or Lay Preacher's Gazette (Walpole, NH) lists John T. Gilman with 40 votes.

sub_unit.name: Keene
sub_unit.note: The New-hampshire Sentinel (Keene, NH) and Dartmouth Gazette (Hanover, NH) list 4 scattering votes.
The Philadelphia Gazette and Daily Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA), March 16 and 19, reports 146 votes for John T. Gilman in Keene.

sub_unit.name: Lempster
sub_unit.note: The Courier of New Hampshire (Concord, NH), Village Messenger (Amherst, NH), The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH) and New-hampshire Sentinel (Keene, NH) list John T. Gilman with 60 votes.
The Dartmouth Gazette (Hanover, NH) lists John T. Gilman with 70 votes.

sub_unit.name: Marlow
sub_unit.note: The Republican Gazette (Concord, NH) and The Sun. Dover Gazette and County Advertiser (Dover, NH) list 42 scattering votes

sub_unit.name: Rindge
sub_unit.note: The Courier of New Hampshire (Concord, NH) lists John T. Gilman with 71 votes.
The History of the Town of Rindge lists John T. Gilman with 158 votes.

sub_unit.name: Unity
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Unity.

sub_unit.name: Walpole
sub_unit.note: The Courier of New Hampshire (Concord, NH), Farmer's Museum, or Lay Preacher's Gazette (Walpole, NH), Village Messenger (Amherst, NH) and The Sun. Dover Gazette and County Advertiser (Dover, NH) list 20 scattering votes.

sub_unit.name: Winchester
sub_unit.note: The New-hampshire Sentinel (Keene, NH) lists John T. Gilman with 76 votes.

sub_unit.name: Adams
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Adams.

sub_unit.name: Canaan
sub_unit.note: The Dartmouth Gazette (Hanover, NH) lists John T. Gilman with 93 votes and Timothy Walker with 12 votes.

The Village Messenger (Amherst, NH), The United States Oracle of the Day (Portsmouth, NH), The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH) and The Republican Ledger (Portsmouth, NH) list Timothy Walker with 6 votes.

sub_unit.name: Chatham
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Chatham.

sub_unit.name: Cockburne
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Cockburne.

sub_unit.name: Colebrook
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Colebrook.

sub_unit.name: Coventry
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Coventry.

sub_unit.name: Dalton
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Dalton.

sub_unit.name: Franconia
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Franconia.

sub_unit.name: Grafton
sub_unit.note: The Courier of New Hampshire (Concord, NH) lists John T. Gilman with 28 votes and Timothy Walker with 40 votes in Grafton.

sub_unit.name: Haverhill
sub_unit.note: The Village Messenger (Amherst, NH) lists John T. Gilman with 48 votes.

sub_unit.name: Lebanon
sub_unit.note: The Farmer's Museum, or Lay Preacher's Gazette (Walpole, NH), Village Messenger (Amherst, NH), The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH) and New-hampshire Sentinel (Keene, NH) list John T. Gilman with 108 votes and Timothy Walker with 13 votes. The Dartmouth Gazette (Hanover, NH) initially lists John T. Gilman with 108 votes and Timothy Walker with 13 votes but this was amended to 172 and 10.

sub_unit.name: Lincoln
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Lincoln.

sub_unit.name: Lyme
sub_unit.note: The Farmer's Museum, or Lay Preacher's Gazette (Walpole, NH) reports 175 votes for John T. Gilman in Lyme.

sub_unit.name: Stewartstown
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Stewartstown.

sub_unit.name: Andover
sub_unit.note: The History of the Town of Andover lists the 40 votes for Timothy Walker as being cast for Charles Walker.
The Republican Gazette (Concord, NH) and The Sun. Dover Gazette and County Advertiser (Dover, NH) list John T. Gilman with 52 votes.

sub_unit.name: Brookline
sub_unit.note: The Village Messenger (Amherst, NH) lists John T. Gilman with 52 votes.

sub_unit.name: Derryfield
sub_unit.note: The Farmer's Museum, or Lay Preacher's Gazette (Walpole, NH), Village Messenger (Amherst, NH), The Philadelphia Gazette and Daily Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) and New-hampshire Sentinel (Keene, NH) list John T. Gilman with 30 votes.
The Republican Ledger (Portsmouth, NH) lists Timothy Walker with 24 votes.

sub_unit.name: Dunbarton
sub_unit.note: The Republican Ledger (Portsmouth, NH), March 17, reports 118 votes for Timothy Walker in Dunbarton.

sub_unit.name: Hancock
sub_unit.note: The Courier of New Hampshire (Concord, NH), The United States Oracle of the Day (Portsmouth, NH), The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH), Dartmouth Gazette (Hanover, NH), Republican Gazette (Concord, NH) and The Sun. Dover Gazette and County Advertiser (Dover, NH) list Timothy Walker with 62 votes.

sub_unit.name: Henniker
sub_unit.note: The Sun. Dover Gazette and County Advertiser (Dover, NH) lists John T. Gilman with 81 votes, Timothy Walker with 16 votes and 25 scattering votes.

sub_unit.name: Hopkinton
sub_unit.note: The United States Oracle of the Day (Portsmouth, NH), The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH), The Republican Ledger (Portsmouth, NH) and Republican Gazette (Concord, NH) list John T. Gilman with 110 votes and Timothy Walker with 77 votes.
The New-hampshire Sentinel (Keene, NH) lists John T. Gilman with 110 votes.

sub_unit.name: Kearsage Gore
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Kearsage Gore.

sub_unit.name: New Boston
sub_unit.note: The Republican Ledger (Portsmouth, NH) lists John T. Gilman with 18 votes.
The Republican Gazette (Concord, NH) lists John T. Gilman with 72 votes and Timothy Walker with 81 votes.

sub_unit.name: Peterborough
sub_unit.note: The United States Oracle of the Day (Portsmouth, NH) and The Republican Ledger (Portsmouth, NH) report 123 votes for John T. Gilman in Peterborough.
The Farmer's Museum, or Lay Preacher's Gazette (Walpole, NH) and The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH) report no votes for Timothy Walker in Peterborough.

sub_unit.name: Weare
sub_unit.note: The Village Messenger (Amherst, NH) lists John T. Gilman with 58 votes and Timothy Walker with 170 votes.

sub_unit.name: Wilton
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Wilton.

sub_unit.name: Windsor
sub_unit.note: The Farmer's Museum, or Lay Preacher's Gazette (Walpole, NH), Village Messenger (Amherst, NH), The Philadelphia Gazette and Daily Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) and New-hampshire Sentinel (Keene, NH) list John T. Gilman with 37 votes.

sub_unit.name: Allenstown
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Allenstown.

sub_unit.name: Canterbury
sub_unit.note: The Republican Gazette (Concord, NH) lists 1 scattering vote.

sub_unit.name: Chester
sub_unit.note: The Courier of New Hampshire (Concord, NH) and the Farmer's Museum, or Lay Preacher's Gazette (Walpole, NH) list 5 scattering votes.

sub_unit.name: Chichester
sub_unit.note: The Republican Gazette (Concord, NH) lists John T. Gilman with 32 votes.

sub_unit.name: Concord
sub_unit.note: The Republican Ledger (Portsmouth, NH) lists Timothy Walker with 155 votes.
The Republican Gazette (Concord, NH) lists 32 votes for John Langdon in Concord.

sub_unit.name: Deerfield
sub_unit.note: The Republican Ledger (Portsmouth, NH) and Republican Gazette (Concord, NH) list John T. Gilman with 66 votes and Timothy Walker with 87 votes.

sub_unit.name: Epping
sub_unit.note: The Village Messenger (Amherst, NH), The United States Oracle of the Day (Portsmouth, NH), The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH), The Republican Ledger (Portsmouth, NH) and New-hampshire Sentinel (Keene, NH) list Timothy Walker with 36 votes.

sub_unit.name: Exeter
sub_unit.note: The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH) lists 4 scattering votes.
The Republican Ledger (Portsmouth, NH) lists 247 votes for John T. Gilman in Exeter.

sub_unit.name: Greenland
sub_unit.note: The Republican Ledger (Portsmouth, NH) lists John T. Gilman with 14 votes.

sub_unit.name: Hampton Falls
sub_unit.note: The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH) lists Timothy Walker with 2 votes.

sub_unit.name: Kensington
sub_unit.note: The Village Messenger (Amherst, NH), The United States Oracle of the Day (Portsmouth, NH), The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH), The Republican Ledger (Portsmouth, NH), New-hampshire Sentinel (Keene, NH), The Philadelphia Gazette and Daily Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) and Republican Gazette (Concord, NH) list Timothy Walker with 15 votes.

sub_unit.name: Kingston
sub_unit.note: The United States Oracle of the Day (Portsmouth, NH) and The Republican Ledger (Portsmouth, NH) list Timothy Walker with 36 votes.

sub_unit.name: New Castle
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in New Castle.

sub_unit.name: North Hampton
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in North Hampton.

sub_unit.name: Nottingham
sub_unit.note: The Village Messenger (Amherst, NH), The United States Oracle of the Day (Portsmouth, NH), The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH) and The Republican Ledger (Portsmouth, NH) list Timothy Walker with 83 votes.

sub_unit.name: Pittsfield
sub_unit.note: The Courier of New Hampshire (Concord, NH) lists Timothy Walker with 7 votes.

sub_unit.name: Rye
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Rye.

sub_unit.name: Barnstead
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Barnstead.

sub_unit.name: Burton
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Burton.

sub_unit.name: Effingham
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Effingham.

sub_unit.name: Middleton
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Middleton.

sub_unit.name: Moultonborough
sub_unit.note: The Courier of New Hampshire (Concord, NH) initially lists Timothy Walker with 139 votes and no votes for John T. Gilman but amends this to 46 votes for John T. Gilman and 48 votes for Timothy Walker. No other New Hampshire paper lists these results, with the Farmer's Museum, or Lay Preacher's Gazette (Walpole, NH), Village Messenger (Amherst, NH), The United States Oracle of the Day (Portsmouth, NH), The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH), New-hampshire Sentinel (Keene, NH), Dartmouth Gazette (Hanover, NH) and Republican Gazette (Concord, NH) listing the 139 votes for Walker and none for Gilman. However, as in 1800, the results in Moultonborough were 42 for Gilman and 60 for Walker and in 1802 they would be 45 for Gilman and 34 for Republican candidate John Langdon, the 46 to 48 result is the likely correct result.

sub_unit.name: New Hampton
sub_unit.note: The United States Oracle of the Day (Portsmouth, NH) reports 75 votes for John T. Gilman in New Hampton.
The Village Messenger (Amherst, NH), March 21, reports 78 votes for John T. Gilman in New Hampton.

sub_unit.name: Rochester
sub_unit.note: The Farmer's Museum, or Lay Preacher's Gazette (Walpole, NH) and Village Messenger (Amherst, NH) list John T. Gilman with 61 votes.
The History of the Town of Rochester lists John T. Gilman with 62 votes and Timothy Walker with 278 votes.

sub_unit.name: Somersworth
sub_unit.note: The Farmer's Museum, or Lay Preacher's Gazette (Walpole, NH), Village Messenger (Amherst, NH), The New Hampshire Gazette (Portsmouth, NH), New-hampshire Sentinel (Keene, NH) and Republican Gazette (Concord, NH) list John T. Gilman with 51 votes and Timothy Walker with 40 votes.

sub_unit.name: Wolfeboro
sub_unit.note: The United States Oracle of the Day (Portsmouth, NH), March 21, reports 37 votes for John T. Gilman in Wolfeboro.
The Republican Ledger (Portsmouth, NH), March 17, reports 27 votes for John T. Gilman and 120 votes for Timothy Walker in Wolfeboro.
